mistrust.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the feeling that you cannot trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly
mistrust.translation[0].definitions[0].e: He had a deep mistrust of the legal profession.
mistrust.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to not trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly
mistrust.translation[1].definitions[0].e: As a very small child she had learned to mistrust adults.
